commitResults.messageTitle: Rename main class and implement skeletal version
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot was previously using the placeholder name Duke.

Renamed the main class to Bingy to differentiate from other chatbots.
Add a greeting and exit message to establish a basic skeletal structure.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Bingy chatbot with greeting, echo, and exit
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement a version of Bingy where bot echos whatever user inputted and
exits gracefully when user inputs "bye".

Implementation previously contained the entire code within the main
class.

Separation of concerns help improve readability and makes it easier to
maintain code and add features in future

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to add task and list tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously chatbot only echos user input. To meet Level 2 requirements,
chatbot is now able to add task and list all tasks when user inputs
"list"

commitResults.messageTitle: Ability to mark tasks as done or not
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, taskList is just a string array. To fully support boolean
isDone for individual tasks, Task class is added and is encapsulated
within taskList.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for three types of tasks.
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously only one task type is supported. Now ToDo, Deadline, and
Event tasks are implemented. Abstract parent class task is implemented to
achieve inheritance of parent class of ToDo, Deadline, and Event tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test using the I/O redirection technique
commitResults.messageBody: Automated testing for initiating different event types

Add error handling for invalid command input and empty deadline/event
timings. Previously unreadable long string of error message is thrown to
users, now error message is readable and provides action for users to
take to rectify input error.

Previously tasks cannot be deleted. Implement task deletion along with
error handling.
